DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study demonstrate Intraocular Pressure ( IOP ) lower efficacy Travoprost Ophthalmic Solution 0.004 % superior Pilocarpine 1 % patient chronic angle-closure glaucoma ( CACG ) .
DOC.brief_title: Travoprost 0.004 % Versus Pilocarpine 1 % Patients With Chronic Angle Closure Glaucoma ( CACG )
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 18 year Chronic Angle Closure Glaucoma ( CACG ) 2135 millimeter mercury mean intraocular pressure Eligibility visit day 9 AM Peripheral iridotomy perform ≥ 1 Month prior Screening visit Anterior chamber angle trabecular meshwork visible ≥180 degree gonioscopy without indentation Peripheral anterior synechiae ( PAS ) Traumatic damage anterior chamber angle History ocular inflammation surgery ( except iridotomy ) ≤ 3 month Patients safely discontinue use ocular hypotensive medication ( ) 12 day 14 week Visual Acuity ≥ 1.0 Contact lens wearer
